thread.title: Jeremy Corbyn considers adopting Nato spending guarantee in rethink of defence policy
thread.title_full: Jeremy Corbyn considers adopting Nato spending guarantee in rethink of defence policy - Worldnews.com

author: wn.com
title: Jeremy Corbyn considers adopting Nato spending guarantee in rethink of defence policy
text: Jeremy Corbyn, the Labour leader, is considering adopting the Nato commitment of spending 2 per cent of national income on defence, even though he has previously opposed the target. It is understood that some of the small group of MPs who back Mr Corbyn, who has suffered a difficult first few weeks in charge, believe making the commitment would head off accusations that he is weak on defence. Making the commitment has been suggested as part of Mr Corbynâ€™s broader review of party policies. Committing to 2 per cent would also provide him with cover to pursue one of his most important personal causes, scrapping the Trident nuclear deterrent, an issue he has campaigned on for nearly 50 years.
